description: This wood-aged blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon has ripe fruits and plenty of the crisp acidity typical of the vintage. Its wood touches are subtle, just enough to give a creamy texture. The wine has a rich texture and will certainly age for another few months. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Bélingard 2014 Réserve White (Bergerac Sec)

description: Crisp and with good acidity, this is a light, fruity and forward wine. Lively, balanced and with plenty of taut fruitiness at the end, it is very ready to drink.
title: Trocard 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a classic Bordeaux-style white wine with its cool herbal character and light perfume from the Muscadelle in the blend. The wine has no oak aging, just ripe fruit that has citrus, pineapple and green fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Château Bélingard 2015 Bélingard White (Bergerac Sec)

description: Intensely herbaceous, this is almost too fruity and crisp for its own good. It's dominated by juicy citrus fruits, gooseberries and forward acidity. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Larroque 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A bright, light and fruity wine that's already delicious to drink. With lemon and green apple fruit, it also has acidity that cuts through the aftertaste.
title: Chai de Bordes 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This herbaceous, classically fruity wine is given a push by a touch of spice. It's bright, light, and fresh, with a green aftertaste. It's ready to drink.
title: Château Borie de Noaillan 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Pure Sauvignon, this is a tropical fruit flavored wine. It's bright and fruity while also showing a dense texture of grapefruit and steely minerality. The combination makes for an intense wine that's likely to need time, so drink from 2017.
title: Château la Louvière 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Rich and full-bodied, it's full of tropical fruits that dominate the ripe texture. Hints of wood are there as well as the natural crisp acidity of Sauvignon Blanc. It needs time to develop and bring out all its ripe flavors. Drink from 2016.
title: Château de France 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Muscadelle is fruity and lightly perfumed. It has a herbal character as well, along with bright acidity and a chalk and mineral texture. It is ready to drink, although it will be better from late 2016.
title: Château Bélingard 2014 Bélingard Blanc White (Bergerac Sec)

description: From Chiles Valley, this blend of 71% Semillon and 29% Sauvignon Blanc is one of the best wines of its type of the vintage. Cofermented and barrel aged in 15% new French oak, it shows extraordinary richness, and savory flavors of green and yellow tree fruits, green tea, cashew, Asian spices and gingery vanilla. It even has some dusty tannins that make for grip and structure. The finish is absolutely dry.
title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2006 Gemini White Wine White (Napa Valley)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A definite burnt character on the nose, but the fruit has proper richness, the wood perhaps showing too much high toast. The freshness should be kept and not lost in the wood.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2009 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. Very fresh. With just a light touch of wood spice, and a great burst of citrus, grapefruit, a little lychee from Muscadelle.
title: Le Nardian 2009 Barrel sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: 89-91 Barrel sample. A full-bodied wine that lacks some definition. It has fatness, weight, but the freshness is not all there.
title: Château Bouscaut 2009 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 88-90 Barrel sample. Very apply wine, with light botrytis character, some spice and very fresh fruit. It is bright and almost crisp.
title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2009 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: De Sante has struggled with Sauvignon Blanc over the years, and while this blend, with 40% Sémillon, contains some good citrus flavor, it's aggressive in drily sour green pyrazines.
title: De Sante 2008 L'Atelier White (Napa Valley)

description: This is herbaceous, but it also has a ripe yellow-fruit character. It is fresh and crisp, with a great depth of flavor. Its bright acidity and tight-textured finish make this a food wine.
title: Château Laulerie 2010 Comtesse de Ségur  (Montravel)

description: The intense herbaceous aroma is softened on the palate by the wine's lemon-curd flavor and smooth texture. Rich with intense fruitiness, this has notes of black currant and pink grapefruit, with bright acidity on the finish.
title: Château Thénac 2011 Fleur du Périgord White (Bergerac Sec)

description: This wine is named after a windmill on the Conti family property. It is rich, with a spicy new-wood flavor. While it has plenty of structure, the acidity is subdued.
title: Château Tour des Gendres 2010 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)

description: This is a wine that brings out a soft, tropical character allied to a citrus and a herbaceous element. It's open, attractive and soft, and it's ready to drink.
title: Augey 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: 92—94 Barrel sample. A fat, full wine, this is rich, intense, concentrated. Great layers of botrytis and apricot flavors give it attraction and power.—R.V.
title: Château Rieussec 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. Like many of the Sauternes in 2008, this is dominated by huge, concentrated botrytis. The fruits are dried, with orange peel coming through as a final, fresh lift.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. With its gold color, this announces richness. The texture is rich, a wine that rounds in the mouth, giving sweetness, tropical flavors and big, ripe fruit. Only to finish, does the acidity arrive.
title: Château de Myrat 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. An impressive wine. It shows just the right balance of dry botrytis and sweet fruit, bringing a firm structure as well as ripe bitter orange marmalade flavors.
title: Château Filhot 2008 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 92-94 Barrel sample. With its big, almost dry core of botrytis, this is going to be an intense wine - many years from now. For the present, the acidity gives it some freshness, while it remains concentrated.
title: Château Suau 2008 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 92—94 Barrel sample. There is big, and serious botrytis here. With its powerful structure, its dry botrytis, here's a wine that will certainly need aging. Very powerful, intense.
title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2006 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: This crisp, lemon-flavored wine has a ripe, full character. It is rich with apples, apricots and delicious acidity at the end.
title: Les Hauts de Lagarde 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This fragrant, spicy wine is soft and rounded. It is still developing to give a wine that will be warm and full. It misses something of the essential fruitiness.
title: Château Au Grand Paris 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Fruity and juicy, this is an attractive blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, giving a tight, mineral-driven wine. With its pink grapefruit and crisp green apple fruits, it is young and can age, although not for long. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Grand Jean 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This delicious, fruity wine is full of acidity and crisp fruit. Light, bright and dominated by green and citrus fruits, it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Vircoulon 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a crisp and herbal wine that is both fruity and finely textured. With layers of acidity and green fruit flavors, it is bright, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Château Barbé 2015  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is a lively crisp wine with a creamy texture and a perfumed character. It is ripe and full with just enough acidity to give freshness.
title: Château Jeanguillon 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Very herbaceous, dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is powered by green fruits, citrus and layers of wood. Ripe, crisp, with a tangy finish.
title: Château Couhins 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: A soft, ripe wine, its fruit rounded by an oily Sémillon texture. There is weight here, wih spice, wood and a creamy aftertaste. For medium-term aging.
title: Château Olivier 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: Still very young, this is a Maison Bouey wine with good potential. It offers hints of the ripe yellow fruits and richness that will come as it develops. The touch of perfumed spice means it is also a wine to savor as an apéritif.
title: Château Lestruelle 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: So rich that it is almost sweet. The yellow fruits give considerable ripeness to this intense, spicy wine. With its smooth, oily texture and its layers of wood, it is almost too much.
title: Château Tour des Gendres 2009 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)

description: A creamy, wood-aged white that simultaneously emphasizes crisp Sauvignon Blanc fruit and minerality. Hints of pineapple and lemon go with a tight texture. A rich yet fresh wine that could age for a few years but can also be enjoyed now.
title: Le Nardian 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Rounded wine, showing ripe tropical flavors as well as a more citrus character. The wine is full, attractively textured with a buttery edge. Spice and green herbs come through to finish. Screwcap.
title: Château Larroque 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This 100% Sauvignon Blanc with six months in French oak is fresh with attractive fruitiness and light acidity. It has spice, a touch of toast and full yellow fruits. The aftertaste brings in a more citrus character that lets the wine finish with freshness. Drink now. Laurent Dubois is the family's ninth generation at this northern Gironde property.
title: Château Les Bertrands 2014 Cuvée Prestige  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a tight, mineral-driven wine with fresh acidity and a crisp character. Sémillon dominated, it conveys green fruits, bright acidity and a lively, tangy aftertaste. The wine is refreshing, fruity and ready to drink. Nicolas Thienpont and his brothers bought this 16-acre property in 1988.
title: Château les Charmes Godard 2014  Francs Côtes de Bordeaux

description: This is the second wine of Clos Haut-Peyraguey. It comes from a fine Sauternes vintage with a great balance between acidity and rich sweetness. With botrytis, plenty of sweetness, bitter marmalade and apricot fruit and delicious acidity, the wine is almost ready to drink. Just wait until the end of 2017.
title: Château Clos Haut-Peyraguey 2013 Symphonie de Haut-Peyraguey  (Sauternes)

description: 87-89 Lacking richness, the wine has acidity, some sweetness, but misses definition and density.
title: Château Lamothe 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 87-89 Soft wine, its acidity light. Pineapple and green apple flavors, with hints of wood.
title: Château Ferrande 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 87-89 The wine tastes light, with a hard edged mineral character, the richness still a distance away.
title: Château Filhot 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 87-89 A wine that is all structure, with very little fruit. It has a hard, metallic edge.
title: Château Suau 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: The blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon has produced an attractive, fruity wine that's young and fresh. Light and bright, with delicious final acidity, its structure suggests it could age; drink from the end of 2015.
title: Barton & Guestier 2013 Passeport  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This refreshing wine from the Seze family of Fronsac is light, crisp and packed with fruit. Crisp with citrus flavors it is ready to drink now.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A crisp blend of Sémillon, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscadelle, this is a ripe wine, showing the warmth of this vintage. It is lightly perfumed with apricot and red-apple flavors. The aftertaste is all about tangy fruit. Drink now.
title: Château du Moulin 2015  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This concentrated, herbal wine has a good balance between the great fruit and the tangy, zesty texture. With its fruity character and spicy aftertaste, it's already a pleasure to drink.
title: Château le Grand Verdus 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Crisp and fruity, this wine is full of apple and citrus flavors. It also features a touch of wood and spice, with a creamy aftertaste from the light wood aging. Drink now.
title: Château Mont-Pérat 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Dense and opulent, this is a fine, ripe wine. There is great weight here, along with flavors of nutmeg and white peach. Acidity and a firm, youthful texture all promise aging. Drink this wine from 2017.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2010  Sauternes

description: This is a very spicy wine with weight, great depth of flavor and concentration. Fine acidity cuts through the core, balancing sweetness and adding freshness to flavors of wild thyme-honey and orange marmalade. Drink the wine from 2017.
title: Château Coutet 2010  Barsac

description: The high proportion of Sémillon in the blend gives the wine an extra richness. That rounds out the more herbaceous character and brings in ripe peach and kiwi flavors. It's already a lively, drinkable wine, but should only improve over another few months.
title: Château l'Avocat 2010  Graves

description: A well-balanced wine that both shows an herbaceous character and a ripe, full flavor that brings in yellow fruits and green plums. It has a well-judged hint of spice from wood aging to give extra richness. Drink from 2013.
title: Château Magnol 2012 Les Charmes de Magnol  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The chalk subsoil of the Bélingard estate gives this wine its textured character. The wood aging smoothes out the crisp acidity of Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon and adds a light layer of toast. It is still a young wine and will be better from late 2016 or even 2017.
title: Château Bélingard 2013 Réserve White (Bergerac Sec)

description: A soft, lightly tropical wine with attractive acidity and grapefruit as well as pineapple flavors. It is crisp, very fruity and ready to drink.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: There is a tantalizing hint of perfume in this 85% Sauvignon Blanc and 15% Muscadelle blend that makes the wine both ripe and textured. With a touch of pepper as well as crisp apple, the wine is rich and ready to drink.
title: Château les Bertrands 2015 Cuvée Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Full and wood-aged, this wine is smoothly textured. It's ripe and spicy, with apricot fruit and some minerality. Rich and worth aging for 2–3 years.
title: Clos des Terrasses 2008 White (Bergerac Sec)

description: Tight and crisply fruity, this wine comes from a property in the Vignobles Signé family since 1649. With a strong herbal character, it is refreshing and already delicious, bright and lively. Plenty of acidity keeps this wine packed with forward fruit. Drink now.
title: Château Petit Moulin 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Unusually set in a Burgundy-shape bottle rather than the normal Bordeaux bottle, this low-sulfur wine comes from a biodynamic vineyard. It is ripe with yellow fruits and rich acidity. It has a rounded character, with an edge of minerality and light spice. This delicious wine is ready to drink.
title: Chateau Peybonhomme-les-Tours 2015 Le Blanc Bonhomme  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Well-balanced, ripe and toasty, it has all the elements in the right place. It's rich, packed with spice, apricot and red apple fruits given a creamy texture by the wood aging. The wine could benefit by waiting until 2015, although it's delicious now.
title: Château Bois de Rolland 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Steely and tight, it has intense acidity, a dense texture and powerful green apple and grapefruit flavors. The wine is still finding its way, suggesting considerable potential for long-term aging. Drink from 2018.
title: Château Latour-Martillac 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a lightly sweet wine that has perfumed apricot and orange fruits. Balanced with acidity, this would be just right as an apéritif.
title: Château le Raz 2010 White (Côtes de Montravel)

description: This soft wine is still waiting for its intensity to come through. The acidity is there, as is ripe, honeyed fruit. Wait until 2022 to open it.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2014 Charmilles  (Sauternes)

description: Apricot and orange flavors are still right up front in this rich wine. Its acidity and poise show a balance that is delicious now. The aftertaste is crisp, cool and stylish.
title: Château Simon 2009 Cuvée Exceptionelle  (Sauternes)

description: This is a soft wine from the warm white vintage of 2015. It is a touch herbal and much more tropical and white fruits. The balance is just right, so drink now.
title: Saveur des Vins de France 2015 Les Portes de Bordeaux  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A soft and ripe wine, its Sauvignon Blanc component is well into the tropical fruit spectrum. Pineapple and white fruits give the wine its full, spicy and peppery character. There is just enough acidity to keep it crisp.
title: Château Landonnet 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a ripe, full wine with flavors of pineapple and apricots. Still developing, it still has a strongly mineral texture, so wait until 2018. This third-generation family estate hosts monthly musical and tasting events with estate fruit, vegetables and honey for sale.
title: Château Bardins 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Showing the ripeness of the vintage, this is a smooth, lightly textured wine, with plenty of yellow and citrus fruits. The wine needs a few months, so drink from late 2017.
title: Château de Costis 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a light wine from the stable of offerings from the Courselle sisters. It has a pale character, just hinting at citrus flavors and lively acidity. It is an apéritif style, light, bright and ready to drink.
title: Château Thieuley 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A light, bright and fruity wine from the Lafite stable, this is a fine apéritif style. Crisp green fruitiness comes with a hint of a more steely character. It is ready to drink.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2016 Légende  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A pure citrus-flavored wine, this is refreshing and light. Its crispness will soften over the next few months, but drink now for the forward fruitiness.
title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Carrelet d'Estuaire  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is a wine with potential. For now, it is textured and tight. For the future, plenty of citrus, crisp acidity and ripe apple flavors promise a fruity, fragrant wine. The grapes, vinified in wood, are from the Graves and Entre-Deux-Mers. Drink from 2016.
title: Michel Lynch 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This Sauvignon Blanc, Sémillon and Muscadelle blend is rounded and ripe, with yellow fruit flavors to go with the fresher acidity. It shows the ripe, tropical side of the Sauvignon Blanc—rich and full in the mouth. Drink from early 2016.
title: Château Borie de Noaillan 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Bright, crisp and fruity, this is a classic white Bordeaux. It is fresh with just a touch of herbaceousness, followed by a riper orange and green plum character. The aftertaste brings in spice as well as fruity acidity. Produced by Crus et Domaines de France.
title: Château Fonfroide 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: 90-92 A wine that shows acidity, a tension between fruit and richness, delicately structured, very aromatic. The texture shows potential richness.
title: Château Doisy-Védrines 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 90-92 Concentrated, structure, a wine that pushes power and density. The year's acidity adds the necessary freshness. Impressive.
title: Château Broustet 2010 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 90-92 Structured, ripe wine, full of tight botrytis character and acidity. The wine is spicy, complex, rich.
title: Château Bastor-Lamontagne 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 89-91 Both freshness and richness are well combined in this elegant Sauternes. What it misses in weight, it gains in honey and apricot flavors.
title: Château Raymond-Lafon 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: Lean, with acidity but not high richness, this is a light, simple wine, the fruit flavors edging towards sweet apples.
title: Château d'Arche 2004  Sauternes

description: Aromas of fresh cantaloupe melon and apricots, are echoed in the flavors of this tropical fruit wine, which is ripe and full, with the acidity coming from nectarines and some toast.
title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Château Paradis Casseuil  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Clean and crisp, this Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon blend has flavors of lemons, limes, pineapples and spices. It's technically dry, but finishes with honeysuckle sweetness.
title: St. Supéry 2007 Virtú White (Napa Valley)

description: Full of acidity, this is also a really fruity 100% Sauvignon Blanc. Great citrus and green apple flavors go with a mineral edge and a final fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is crisp and packed with both acidity and lively citrus fruits, balanced between fruit and freshness. It makes a good apéritif wine, light and very much in balance. The mostly red-wine property, owned by Régis and Hervé Grandeau, sits on a slope above the Right Bank of the Garonne River only four miles from Bordeaux city.
title: Château Lauduc 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Steel and nervy mineralogy are the hallmarks of this wine at this stage. It's still waiting for the fruit to develop, but expect crisp citrus and succulent apples. The aftertaste, tensely fresh now, should soften as the wine develops. This 90% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Sémillon blend comes from the estate's small vineyard on the slope near Cadillac.
title: Château Boisson 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The Queyren family's 100 years in the wine business makes good use of its Entre-Deux-Mers' vineyard of 80% Sauvignon Blanc and 20% Sémillon. This is a wine with some wood aging, giving spice and ripe yellow fruits in balance. A strong line of acidity cuts through this warmer, toasty character to leave an aftertaste of fresh citrus.
title: Château Pilet 2014 Les Hauts de Massonne  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This late harvest wine is soft with delicious creamed apple and light honey flavors. It's spicy and attractive to drink as an apéritif.
title: Château de Marsan 2015 Moelleux  (Premieres Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a perfumed wine with yellow fruit and baked apple flavors. Attractive and with delicious acidity, it's ready to drink now.
title: Château Les Bertrands 2016 Cuvée Tradition  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The wine is dominated by crisp, herbal flavors. With acidity, citrus notes and just a touch of spice, it's fruity and bright. Drink now.
title: Château Lacaussade Saint-Martin 2016 Trois Moulins  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: The dominance of young Sémillon in the blend gives considerable herbaceousness. The wine has a fresh, grassy character, its acidity offering freshness within the full texture.
title: Château Tour des Gendres 2010 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

description: A Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon blend made in the white Bordeaux style, with lots of oak. Too much oak, in fact. The wine is dominated by smoky char and caramel, and tastes sweet in butterscotch.
title: Pure Cru 2009 Purety White (Napa Valley)

description: A Sémillon-Sauvignon Blanc blend, this wine is brisk in acids, with a touch of cream and toast. But the star is the fruit. It's rich and complex in lemons, limes and tangerines.
title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2011 Barrack Blanc White (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Herbaceous and green, this is a crisp wine, still with fresh, tangy fruit after four years. It is light, bright with lemon and green herb flavors and a tight aftertaste. Drink now. This small Roux estate has been in the family for five generations; now guided by Romain Roux. the winery is solar powered.
title: Château Laforêt 2011  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This is more on the fresh side, with a bright citric component adding a crisp character to the botrytis richness. The texture is tight, apple and pear skin cutting through the sweetness.
title: Château Nairac 2007  Barsac

description: This barrel fermented blend of equal parts Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon shows aromas and flavors of guava, kiwi, green tea and lees. It's full, sweet and viscous in feel, finishing a bit short.
title: Auclair 2014 96 Cedars White Wine Artz Vineyard White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is an attractively balanced blend of 60% Sauvignon Blanc and 40% Sémillon. It is still at its youthful, green-herb stage although signs indicate that the wine will round out and fill. The aftertaste hints at crisp apples and Rocha pears.
title: Exem 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: It's impressive what a small addition of Sauvignon Gris and Muscadelle can do to a Sauvignon-Sémillon blend—it turns this into an exotic wine, with spice and lychee flavors.
title: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2010 L'Abbaye White (Bergerac Sec)

description: Crisp and taut, this Lobre family wine is on a tight rope. It balances between intense citrus acidity and riper apricot and pear favors. It will be better from late 2017.
title: Château de l'Aubrade 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: With big, fruity flavors, this is a ripe while also crisp wine. Delicious green and citrus fruits give plenty of acidity along with a sense of richness. Drink this wine now.
title: Château d'Haurets 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Crisp and with a strongly mineral character, this is a young, textured wine. As it softens and gets the ripeness of the vintage, it will become smooth and rich. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Roc Meynard 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is spicy, fruity and packed with herbal and lemon flavors. It will soon be a refreshing wine, lively and with swathes of acidity. Drink from late summer 2017.
title: Château de Bonhoste 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a warm wine, ripe and with hints of yellow fruits as well as crisper acidity. Poised between herbal and riper flavors, it's ready to drink now.
title: Château La Rame 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine from Maison Ginestet is all crisp, green fruit. Light and bright, it bursts with acidity and perfumed fruitiness. Drink now.
designation: Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion Blanc
title: Château Larrivet Haut-Brion 2016 Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Pascal Sirat named this wine for his father and his son. Bright and fruity, it is already deliciously light, refreshing and bright. Acidity jumps out of the glass, giving a crisp, fresh character. The aftertaste is more taut and tense. Drink now.
title: Château Panchille 2016 Blanc de Fernand  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: From vineyards on the slope above Cadillac, this is a tight, mineral-textured wine. With crisp lemon flavors, it is brightly lit with acidity and clean fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Château Suau 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This rich, wood-aged blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc is packed with botrytis and ripe, concentrated fruit. It's opulent, with bitter orange and yellow fruit flavors and a fine cut of acidity to keep it all in shape. Drink now.
title: Château Kalian 2014  Monbazillac

description: This isn't sweet, but just so wonderfully rich. It's the concentration of botrytis that makes the wine. The texture is velvet, but with a spicy bite to it. Apricot, honey and marzipan all contribute to a wine that will age over decades.
title: Château d'Yquem 2005  Sauternes

description: This is a crisp, really fruity wine with a light touch of wood from the six months of barrel aging. It is ripe, lightly herbal balancing citrus flavors with riper yellow fruits. Drink now.
title: Cheval Quancard 2015 Réserve Sauvignon-Sémillon  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Ripe green and white fruits give a fresh while warm character to this wine. An herbaceous element brings in a more tangy character. It is fresh at the end, very fruity while still young. Drink from late 2015. Produced by Grands Chais de France.
title: Mademoiselle Comédie 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This rich wine is dominated by concentrated botrytis tones, yet its acidity and lemon flavors are still very much at the fore. With its firm structure, spice notes and crisp lemon fruit still coming together, it suggests a fine future. Drink from 2023.
title: Château Lamothe Despujols 2014  Sauternes

description: Illogically, there are two second wines at this estate. This is the richer of the two (the other is Lions). It has intensity, spice, ripe apricot fruit and a smooth, dense texture. Its honey and botrytis notes are just right while the thread of acidity keeps it all in place. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Suduiraut 2011 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: This is already a beautiful wine. An intense flavor of dried apricot fruit is balanced by a serious core of botrytis. With its underlying acidity, this is concentrated, ripe and sure to age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Château Suduiraut 2014 Castelnau de Suduiraut  (Sauternes)

description: The wine has a creamy character with weight and richness, if without a strong sensation of acidity. It is opulent with hints of the wood aging. Peach, pear and honey flavors show through at the end.
title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2011 Cos d'Estournel Blanc  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: The sweet wine appellation of Cérons is just next door to Barsac. This 2005, now mature, shows the possibilities of these wines. It still has the botrytis, but it also has a rich texture that is rounding, losing its initial sweetness and gaining complexity. Drink now, or age until 2020.
title: Château de Cérons 2005  Cérons

description: In this strongly wood-aged wine, the spice and toast is as important as the fruit. As the wine matures over the next two to three years, the ripe apricot and pineapple fruit flavors will come through more vividly. Drink from 2015.
title: Château de la Vieille Chapelle 2012 Les Grands Blancs  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A lovely white Bordeaux-style blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris, rich, opulent and full-bodied. Shows citrus, tropical fruit, pear, white flower, green apple and oak-inspired vanilla flavors that change with every sip, as the wine warms in the glass.
title: Chimney Rock 2008 Elevage Blanc White (Napa Valley)

description: This second label of Château de Cérons is lightly honeyed, even though bone dry. It has a soft, ripe texture with yellow fruits as well as a streak of good acidity. The perfumed Sauvignon Gris adds attractiveness. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Calvimont 2016  Graves

description: This delicious wine from old Sémillon vines offers a hint of nuts and spice as well as crisp, clean fruit. It is lively with acidity as well as having a richer side. The wine will be just right from the end of 2017.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This crisp, clean wine has both fruit and acidity in just the right proportions. With lively acidity and hint of herbal and citrus flavors, it is a fine apéritif style. The aftertaste continues this bright and lively character.
title: Château Mission Saint Vincent 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is spicy, ripe and ready to drink. Ripe white stone fruits are laced with citrus acidity to give a lively wine with good fruit intensity. Drink this wine now for instant pleasure.
title: Château Pilet 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This lively, citrus-driven wine has tight acidity over bright grapefruit and lime, giving refreshing crispness. Immediately attractive, it offers an aftertaste that shines with lemon juice.
title: Château Roques Mauriac 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: 98-100 Barrel sample. The aromas are so rich and powerful, with great ripe apricots. There are honey, spice and beautiful sweet spiced pears. This is an extraordinary wine in an extraordinary year in Sauternes.
title: Château d'Yquem 2009 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 97-99 Barrel sample. A tasting from several barrels, because the chateau has not made the final blend, so the rating is provisional. But the wine is so rich, with an almost perfect balance of acidity and ripeness, allied to a complete purity of honeyed botrytis. However the final wine turns out, it will be magnificent.
title: Château Climens 2009 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: 96-98 Barrel sample. A powerful, complex wine, its layers of sweetness mixed with a total dryness from botrytis. The wine is impressively rich, considerably inspired by dried fruits and spice. Certainly for aging over decades.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2009 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 96-98 Barrel sample. Concentrated and dense, this is a wine that fits well into the power of 2009. There is richness, but as well there is great elegance, a great structure of richness and sweetness, with the final bite of honey.
title: Château Rieussec 2009 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 96-98 Barrel sample. A wine that shows intense spice, with ginger and grated nutmeg. This lies over the top of the ripest yellow fruits, added to mango, sweet pears and a fresh, final character. Complex wine with an immense future.
title: Château Coutet 2009 Barrel sample  (Barsac)

description: This perfumed wine conveys attractive balance between its fruit and fresher acidity. A fresh, crisp texture still needs time to settle in. Drink from the end of 2015.
title: Château Haut Mouleyre 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is fresh without being too herbaceous. Sauvignon Blanc controls crispness with flavors of almonds, citrus and quince. The tangy, steely aftertaste will soften from the end of 2015.
title: Château Taussin 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Wood aging has produced a well-rounded wine. It has a citrus flavor to go with the more tropical fruit, a good zing of acidity and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now, or age over the next year.
title: Barton & Guestier 2011 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Graves)

description: This wine has rich, intense yellow fruit, orange marmalade and concentrated botrytis flavors. With all the elements in place, it is well poised to mature slowly and gently into a very fine wine. Its concentration is balanced by fresh fruit and and honey notes. Drink from 2023.
title: Château d'Arche 2014  Sauternes

description: This wine is already balanced and developing quickly. It has fine acidity and crisp citrus and floral honey flavors. With its light touch, it's likely to be ready to enjoy. Drink now–2021.
title: Château la Tour Blanche 2014  Sauternes

description: Dominated by Sauvignon Blanc, this wine has a still young, crisp, tight character. As it ages, the yellow fruits and ripe plum flavors will come through, balancing the acidity and giving a ripe, full and generous wine. Drink from 2016.
title: Château les Clauzots 2014  Graves

description: This 50-50 Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon is a rich wine that is full of lightly peppered ripe apple and pear flavors. It feels generous while being full in the mouth with good concentration and crisp acidity. Drink now.
title: Vignobles Carreau Selection 2015 Château l'Escadre  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine is tight, crisp with citrus flavors and intense acidity. It is developing into a refreshing, broader wine that will have a riper character. Wait until late 2017.
title: Château de Marsan 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The 250-year history of the Moreau family is the story of wine: barrel-makers, winery suppliers, viticulturists, winemakers and négociants. The company is now directed by Frédéric Marque. Rich fruit and nutmeg flavors gives this wood-aged wine its ripe and fruity character. It offers zesty lemon and a delicious aftertaste of spiced apple and wood. Drink now.
title: Château Maison Noble 2016 Cuvée Maurice  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Light, bright and with lively acidity, this is already a juicy, delicious wine. It offers good fruitiness, with pink grapefruit flavors and a tangy, zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Merlet 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Richly fruity, this is a wine in progress. Its acidity and texture are still coming together to give a crisp wine with ripe fruit. Lemon and lime flavors will add a refreshing background. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Timberlay 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is still closed, lean and firm with its fruitiness masked by a strong mineral structure. It needs plenty of time to develop, so drink from 2018.
title: Château de Cruzeau 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Quince, toast and ripe apricots combine easily in this full, rich wine. It has attractive spice, juicy apricot juice and a rounded, textured aftertaste conveying nutmeg as well as fresh acidity. Laurent and Sophie Cisneros bought Rouillac with a focus: eliminate chemical pesticides and herbicides. They built a barrel cellar to environmental European standards. Eric Boissenot consults.
title: Château de Rouillac 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Equal parts Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, this wine offers aromas of kiwi, spice and citrus that provide nuance and appeal. It's textured and full in feel, stretching out on the finish.
designation: Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2014 Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Estate Grown White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Produced by the winemaking team of Château Giscours in Margaux, this is finely ripe blend of Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc. With rich tropical fruits and lime flavors, it is balanced and already delicious. Drink now.
title: Petite Sirène 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: While it is certainly rich, this wine has a drying core of botrytis that dominates at the moment. There's remarkable weight and concentration on the palate, but brisk lemon flavors add vibrancy and cut. It is obviously a wine to age, so don't drink before 2018.
title: Château de Malle 2010  Sauternes

description: Dense and textured, this is a powerful, complex wine. It's layered with honey and botrytis, and a concentrated fruitiness with flavors of apricots and creamed pears. There is a great sense of freshness on the finish.
title: Château de Myrat 2010  Barsac

description: This wine is lightly herbaceous, with a crisp while creamy texture that emphasizes perfumed green fruits and refreshing acidity. It is light, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Ginestet 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Light and fruity, this is a crisp, fresh wine. Hints of red apples and yellow fruits are cut with lemon zest. The wine is perfumed and ready to drink.
title: Château Grand Jean 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a perfumed wine, fresh with floral character. An attractive crisp edge makes it ready to drink now.
title: Château la Caderie 2014 Esprit  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Lightly herbaceous, this is a fresh, obviously youthful wine. It is only lightly textured, the main character coming from yellow fruits and pear juice flavors. Drink now, although it will age and improve until 2016.
title: Château Moulin de Vignolle 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: An aromatic wine, it has a rounded texture, a spicy character and only light acidity. Very forward and fruity, it's going to be ready to drink by 2015.
title: Château de Cruzeau 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: It balances a crisp texture against ripe fruitiness. Finely structured, it's very fresh with herbaceous fruits and lively acidity. Drink from 2015.
title: Château le Sartre 2012  Pessac-Léognan

description: Green fruits and an herbal character give this wine brightness and freshness, balanced by riper tropical fruits that come in with their softer edge. Still young, the wine is ready to drink now although is likely to be better from summer 2016.
title: Château Rousset-Caillau 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: This smooth Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine is soft, lightly spicy and ready to drink. It is ripe with only light acidity. Lemon and crisp apples show strongly at the end. Third-generation Lafarge owner Jean-Pierre Leymarie was born on the estate.
title: Château Lafargue 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: A fruity, open wine, this has bright acidity, crisp green fruits, a touch of lemon and a light texture. Ready to drink.
title: Jean Médeville et Fils 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This perfumed wine discloses hints of apricots and white peaches as well as ripe lime juice. It is balanced, fruity with a good touch of minerality to give texture. The aftertaste is all about fresh fruits that will soften over the next few months. Produced by the Ducourt family, first in Bordeaux in 1858 and now one of the largest independent producers in the region. Philippe Ducourt handles the vineyards and Jérémy Ducourt makes this wine.
title: Château Larroque 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Herbaceous in character, this also shows a creamy edge. Notes of ripe apples blend with touches of citrus fruits. A yeasty note spoils the purity of the fruit, but it's likely to disappear as the wine ages for a few months.
title: Château des Perligues 2011  Graves

description: Fresh lemon and gooseberry flavors lend an herbaceous edge to this fruity but tightly textured wine. It has richness and density, but it's a wine that is both refreshing and serious. Keep for a year before drinking.
title: Château Argadens 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Citrus and herb characteristics show strongly in this full-bodied wine. They are enhanced by light wood flavors that smooth out the acidity. The result is a full, rich wine that could age. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Maison Noble 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: More toasty than fruity at this stage, this is a finely made wine with vanilla flavors that dominate the ripe tropical fruits underneath. Give it a year and the wine will balance out richly and smoothly.
title: Château Tour de Mirambeau 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Monbazillac is the lighter cousin of Bordeaux's Sauternes. This wine with its apricot and marmalade flavors is given its richness by concentrated botrytis that adds a dry edge to this sweet unctuous wine. Drink now.
title: Univitis 2013 Domaine de la Guillonie  (Monbazillac)

description: Citrus and tropical fruits dominate this rich wine, while the wood gives caramel. Full and mouthfilling, this is rounded, the acidity veering towards softness. The toast and white plum skins give structure to an open, generous wine.
title: Château Laville Haut-Brion 2005  Pessac-Léognan

description: A blend of Sauvignon Blanc (61%) and Sémillon, with the latter a new addition to this typically varietally designated wine, it opens with aromas of herbs, lemon verbana, white flowers, nut oil and yellow apple. The palate is lean in style, with a lightly creamy feel backed by racy acidity that leads to a white grapefruit, kiwi and pineapple-filled finish.
title: Efeste 2015 Sauvage Boushey Vineyard White (Yakima Valley)

description: Sauvignon Blanc and Sémillon share equal parts of this blend. Aromas of corn silk, tropical fruit and herb give way to full-bodied fruit flavors. It shows a hint of warmth on the finish but largely carries it.
designation: Estate Grown Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2015 Estate Grown Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This wine is ripe, full of spice, toast and intense acidity. It has the herbal character of Sauvignon Blanc along with a fresh, tangy edge. Still tight and closed, it needs to develop; drink from 2018. After two centuries under various ownerships, the derelict Couhins estate was purchased by the French agricultural research institute (INRA) in 1968. After renovating the vineyards, the institute began selling wine in 2007.
title: Château Couhins 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine shows so much rich fruit. It has a herbal edge, but the yellow and white fruits really define it. Wood-aging has left hints of spice, and the wine also has a tangy, mineral edge. It is ready to drink.
title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2013 Aile d'Argent  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: A great value white, with fresh grapefruit and crisp acidity. In a few months, the current raw edge will have softened, as the 60% Sémillon in the blend calms down. But it's still a great summer drink.
title: Château Perron 2006  Graves

description: A welcome addition to the Bunchgrass lineup, this white Bordeaux-style blend is one third barrel-fermented Semillon, two thirds tank-fermented Sauvignon Blanc. The ripe and textural fruit still shows a lightly yeasty character, along with highlights of honey graham cracker.
title: Bunchgrass 2011 Whispering Owl White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Full of ripe fruit, opulent and concentrated, this is a fabulous and impressive wine. It has a beautiful line of acidity balanced with ripe fruits. The wood aging is subtle, just a hint of smokiness and toast. This is one of those wines, from a great white wine vintage, that will age many years. Drink from 2024.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: Dense and beautifully ripe, this is a rounded rich wine. It focuses on the tropical yellow-fruit spectrum. That gives a full wine with wood-spice hints and just the right amount of citrus acidity to give it a lift. Drink this finely structured wine from 2023.
title: Château Smith Haut Lafitte 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: This is a structured wine with its tight acidity and concentrated white and citrus fruits. Produced from a small parcel on the Chevalier estate, it is complex with its mineral texture, its touch of pepper and its fine herbal acidity. It is a wine for long-term aging. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine de Chevalier 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: Attractively perfumed this ripe wine has hints of the crisp acidity that is also there. It's a fresh wine with the potential of richness. Ripe pink grapefruit and tangy acidity are balanced by the warmer flavors of pear and quince. Drink from late 2015.
title: Château la Croix de Roche 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is totally fruit-driven wine. With very fresh citrus acidity, it is as crisp as possible while not losing sight of the potential of its white fruits. There is a delicious steely edge as well as great acidity at the end. The wine is a blend from vineyards planted with 60% Sauvignon blanc, 30% Sémillon and 10% Muscadelle. The estate has been in the Le Grix de la Salle family for 100 years.
title: Chateau le Grand Verdus 2014  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A smooth and velvet-textured wine, where the wood, while dominant, is also there to give an opulence to the ripe fruits. So pear and peach flavors go with spice and there is a fine, apple streak of acidity. With its final concentration of rich flavors this is developing well, giving a caramel and lime acidity finish.
title: Château Bel Air Perponcher 2006  Bordeaux Blanc

description: The Sauvignon (64%) comes from Bacchus with the Sémillon from neighboring Dionysus. After starting out slightly reduced, fig and spice aromas lead to tart, lemon and tropical fruit flavors that need more cohesion and concentration to keep them together.
title: Cloudlift Cellars 2014 Updraft White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: From a selection of bunches that were left on the vines to gather noble rot, this wine is rich and wonderfully concentrated and with layers of botrytis and ripe fruits. Apricots and honey are balanced by the drier edge of the noble rot. It's a young wine still and will be even better from 2019.
title: Château Bélingard 2014 Ortus de Château Bélingard  (Monbazillac)

description: This second wine of whites from both Haut-Brion and La Mission Haut-Brion is both rich and intensely crisp. It has a fine blend between great acidity and grapefruit fruit and a more tropical element. The tangy texture is taut with a mineral edge. Drink from 2020.
title: Château Haut-Brion 2014 La Clarté de Haut-Brion  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Lightly wood aged, this wine is soft while still keeping some fruitiness. Spice and touches of toast are still integrating with the apple and lime flavors. The tangy, zesty aftertaste needs to calm down. Drink from late 2016.
title: Cheval Quancard 2014 Cuvée Clémence  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

description: Light and dilute, this is a pleasant wine, soft with hints of pineapple and a fresh aftertaste. Screw cap.
title: Château d'Haurets 2009  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Soft, open wine, layering apricot and pear juice with some acidity that is fresh, rather than apple crisp. The wine is a little dilute and need to be drunk.
title: Château Julian 2009  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This smooth and creamy wood-aged wine brings a touch of spice to its rich and perfumed character. Ripe and rounded, this wine has apricot and sweet pear flavors.
title: Domaine l'Ancienne Cure 2010 L'Extase White (Bergerac Sec)

description: A white Bordeaux-style blend, crisp and edgy, with green fruit flavors sporting a citrusy kick. Young, tight and tart, it shows its alcohol on the angular finish.
title: Cloudlift Cellars 2010 Updraft White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Very herbaceous, Sauvignon Blanc-dominated wine. It has gooseberry flavors that are rounded out with pea and green bean tastes. A wine that can be drunk young and with seafood. Screwcap.
title: Château Briot 2010  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This wine is a blend of Sémillon (55%) and Sauvignon Blanc from Cave B and Mercer Estate vineyards. Aromas are reticent at present, with notes of reduction, grass, herb and spice. The palate is flavorful, with citrus and tropical-fruit flavors. It delivers a lot of enjoyment.
title: Lauren Ashton Cellars 2016 Cuvée Meline White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: From his Saint-Émilion base, Bertrand Ravache has created two brands: Leo (for Comte Léo de Malet Roquefort) and Les Hauts. This wine is all fruit, ripe and with a mineral edge. It has lots of acidity, lively fruitiness and hints of spice. Drink this fruity wine now.
title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2016 Les Hauts de la Gaffelière  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Considerable noble rot both in its aromas and in its palate give this wine richness and a textured, sweet and dry character. Honeyed with bitter marmalade and dried apricot flavors , it is still young. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Bélingard 2012 Réserve  (Monbazillac)

description: Opulent and ripe, this is a powerful, wood-aged wine. It has a fine mix of tropical fruits, spice and vanilla. The richness is cut through with pink grapefruit to give a fine sense of poise and balance. Age for at least four years.
title: Château Pape Clément 2010  Pessac-Léognan

description: This wine is two-thirds Sémillon and one-third Sauvignon Blanc. Aromas of toasted grapenuts, lemon and spice are followed by broad-feeling fruit flavors that show a lightly creamy feel.
title: Swiftwater Cellars 2015 Proprietary White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A parcel of limestone soil on this estate allows it to produce a small quantity of white wine. Vinified and aged in barrels, this is a soft ripe wine with light toast and lemon flavors. Textured and still young, this will age over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
title: Château Fourcas Dupré 2015 Grand Vin Blanc Sec  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This small estate is outside the main classified growth areas of Sauternes, close to the river Garonne. That makes it a wine that is accessible earlier, with plenty of honey and botrytis. It is already balancing out into a fine orange-marmalade-flavored wine with just the right acidity. Drink now.
title: Château Laribotte 2011  Sauternes

description: The vast 300-acre estate of Château Bonnet in the heart of the Entre-deux-Mers produces a deliciously reliable, good value wine every year. This brand-new 2008 shows some lively yellow fruits as well as a strong citrus element. It has vibrantly fresh, pure fruit and is ready to drink now, but can age for a year. Screwcap.
title: Château Bonnet 2008  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: A 60/40 Sauvignon Blanc/Sémillon blend, done in the Bordeaux style. Fermented in neutral oak, aged sur lie, and left in the barrels for another half year, the wine is lightly toasty with steely fruit flavors and a firm, solid mouthfeel.
title: Saviah 2010 Star Meadows White White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A simple, youthful white, perfumed and spicy as well as crisply fruity. From the Entre-deux-Mers region, it is cool, clean, laden with green plums and white currant flavors. For aging over the next few months.
title: Château du Pin Franc 2012  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a ripe and tropical wine, complex with wood aging. It is warm, intensely rich and piled with mango and pineapple flavors. The acidity and crispness are well behind this smooth, creamy wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Château Pape Clément 2014  Pessac-Léognan

description: This crisp wine has plenty of acidity as well as lively fruits. The structure and texture are light and lifted, with a clean aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Château Lary 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This is a tight wine with acidity and a good future of crispness. Give this attractive wine a few months and its citrus fruit will show well. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Laubes 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Spicy and fruity, this light, balanced wine has easy, crisp fruit and bright acidity showing citrus and spiciness. It is a refreshing wine, ready to drink now.
title: Maison Bouey 2016 Château Baruaud  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: Attractively herbaceous, this is a crisp, light and bright wine. Tight green fruits and plenty of acidity give it a juicy character that makes it refreshing. Drink now. This is one of 15 Bordeaux chateaus by Crus and Domaines de France.
title: Château Mezain 2015  Bordeaux Blanc

description: A gold-colored wine. The palate has intense freshness as well as ripe apricot and orange zest flavors. The acidity cuts through the intense richness, leaving a wine that needs time to fully integrate, and then many more years to mature.
title: Château Guiraud 2007  Sauternes

description: Packed with botrytis, this is a wine whose sweetness is suppressed by richness. Flavors of bitter oranges and white figs go with the intense core of botrytis, followed by a touch of bright acidity. This is a wine whose journey is just beginning.
title: Château Lafaurie-Peyraguey 2007  Sauternes

description: A beautifully ripe wine, layering all the dense botrytis of the vintage with freshest acidity. It has weight, the texture of grainy honey, ripe yellow fruits, mango and orange zest. Impressive and certainly for aging.
title: Château Sigalas Rabaud 2007  Sauternes

description: There is a farmyard quality to the aromas, but the wine itself shows a finely structured character that offers a linear, herbaceous view. The wine has considerable aging potential, bringing out an enticing citrus character.
title: Château Couhins-Lurton 2009  Pessac-Léognan

description: Wood aging has given this a spicy feel. It's rich, full bodied and textured with a citrus tang. The texture is creamy, with pear and grapefruit notes. Age for another two years.
title: Château Thieuley 2010 Cuvée Francis Courselle  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: This is an attractive, relatively light Sauternes. It has a fine botrytis character that's already well integrated with the orange peel and honey flavors. Not for aging; ready to drink.
title: Château Gravas 2010  Sauternes

description: Deliciously crisp, this wine expresses herbaceous fruit, with weight and richness. Full of lime, gooseberry and grapefruit flavors, this is a taut wine that's likely to soften.
title: Château la Grande Métaire 2011 Cuvée la Chapelle  (Entre-Deux-Mers)

description: As its name, boisé, suggests this is a wood-aged white. That gives the wine richness and definite tastiness while keeping plenty of room for the freshest green and citrus fruits and crisp sliced apple. It should be kept a few months, so drink from 2016.
title: Maison Bouey 2014 Maison Blanche Boisé  (Bordeaux Blanc)

description: There is an unusually high (40%) proportion of Sémillon in the blend, which offers the possibility of aging. Although this wine is fresh, lemony and tightly herbaceous now, it will become more rich and the flavors will deepen. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Château les Pasquets 2014  Entre-Deux-Mers

description: Lively and crisp, this wine offers a pure line of citrus fruit. Its acidity and herbal edge are right up front, refreshing and aromatic. The wine is ready to drink now.
title: Château Recougne 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Brightly fruity, this blend with 85% Sauvignon Blanc goes for the tropical-fruit character of the grape. Attractive acidity and a zingy edge are balanced by ripe apricot and pineapple flavors. Drink from late 2017.
title: Château Roquefort 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Full in the mouth, this ripe, spicy wine offers a fruit salad of flavors that are topped with some wood-aging flavors. Drink from 2016 for the wood to be fully integrated into the fruit. After the Jonck family's 350 years in South Africa's Western Cape, vineyard owner Johan Jonck and family decamped to Bordeaux in 2011. Consulting enologist is Eric Bardon.
title: Château Espérance 2014 Instinct  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux)

description: Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, with a touch of perfume from Muscadelle give a wine that, while still young, is ripe and shows a touch of spice from wood aging. It is a rounded wine that has pepper as well as just enough acidity. Drink from 2017.
title: Château Tour des Gendres 2015 Cuvée des Conti White (Bergerac Sec)

description: 91-93 Rich more than dry, the palate a very spicy character, the texture full, unctuous, but more than just sweet.
title: Château d'Arche 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes)

description: 91-93 Fresh, citrus and spicy pear flavors, a wine laced with acidity, a crisp texture and elegant bright aftertaste.
title: Château Haut-Bergey 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: 90-92 The wine has rich citrus and pear flavors, with weight, an oily texture and balanced wood spice to finish. Well structured.
title: Château Rahoul 2010 Barrel sample  (Graves)

description: 90-92 Attractive floral perfumes, a wine that is soft initially then shows a fine herbaceous edge. Crisp, textured with hints of wood.
title: Château Brown 2010 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan)

description: Ripe and tropical, this full-bodied wine conveys mango, quince and ripe white peach that accompany a rich texture. It's going to develop relatively quickly, so drink from 2018. Winemaker Stephan Carrier returned from Napa to take over winemaking after Irish businessman Lochlann Quinn bought the property in 2001. A new winery and barrel cellar opened in 2011. Hubert de Boüard of Château Angelus consults with Carrier. Fieuzal's newsletter is an accurate report on harvests.
title: Château de Fieuzal 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Still tight and closed up, this wine has potential, offering ripe citrus and white fruits and nervy, tangy texture. Concentrated and dense, it's a wine for the long term; drink from 2020. Olivier is a large medieval hunting estate that, since the 19th century, has belonged to the Bethmann family. The 148 acres of vines and forests are managed environmentally.
title: Château Olivier 2013  Pessac-Léognan

description: Very rich and packed with yellow and tropical fruits, this is a complex, wood-aged wine. It has a strong toasty edge that gives burnt spice that is balanced by the rich fruitiness. Acidity follows, making an appearance in the fresh finish. Drink from 2014.
title: Château Tour des Gendres 2011 Moulin des Dames White (Bergerac Sec)
